title: Understanding the ON Clause
text: The ON clause is used in SQL to define the condition for joining tables. It specifies how the records from two tables should be combined based on a related column.

title: Purpose of the ON Clause
text: In a JOIN operation, the ON clause determines which rows from each table are matched and combined in the result set.

hintAnswer: It specifies the matching condition for combining records.
title: Identifying the Correct Function
text: Which of the following best describes the function of the ON portion of a JOIN clause?
choices: It creates the name for the resulting combination.
It limits the total number of output records.
It specifies the matching condition for combining records.
